intro: Mosiera cabanasensis, commonly known as the Cabanas's mosiera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
